description.narrative: 2013. Bevilget: 7 mio DKK, forbrugt 7 mio DKK The regional media cooperation programme with the Middle East and North Africa overall aims at enhancing the democratic role of the media in the MENA region. The programme is organized around three areas of intervention; Greater media freedom and safety; Building of institutions that promote free expression, media freedom and access to information; Professionalization of media content. Furthermore the programme seeks to promote professional networks and mutual understanding between actors within a national, regional and international context (including Danish-Arab dialogue). The programme targets media development in conflict/transition settings in Tunisia, Egypt, Libya, Yemen, Syria and to some extent Jordan. In addition regional thematic components address Investigative Journalism, Documentary Film, media monitoring and twinning. The programme is implemented by International Media Support in collaboration with a host of partners in the Middle East and North Africa, as well as international and Danish partners (including Dansk Journalistforbund, Den Danske Medie og Journalisthøjskole; Den Danske Filmskole among others).
